inn1.comm: on off stump, Cook comes forward and pushes firmly square on the off side
back of a length on the stumps, Cook waits on the back foot and defends back to Mills
forced up to mid-off, looks as though the ball is coming on nicely to the bat

huge appeal from Mills and it's mighty close as the ball is very full and swings back into Cook, who falls over as he tries to work to leg and is struck in line with leg stump. Mills finished by the batsman after his appeal, but couldn't convince the umpire
tucked nicely off the hips through square leg to get England off and running
another cracking ball from Mills, full inswinging yorker which Mustard jabs down it and loses his footing...top start from Mills
outside off and left alone
fuller and brings Cook into a drive, but it isn't timed and rolls rather tamely towards mid-off
short and wide, Cook brings out a strong square cut over the top of backward point. He didn't try to keep that down and already there seems to be much more pace on offer
big stride onto the front foot by Cook, pushed into the covers
angling into Cook and driven to the off side
tries to work into the leg side, misses and is taken on the thigh pad...ball falls towards the slips and they scamper a single
full on off stump, takes a thick inside half of the bat past square leg as Cook tries to drive and the face closes a little on the shot
just a hint of width outside off stump, back of a length and Cook frees his arms with a spanking cover drive which races across the outfield
chases a drive this time but doesn't get near to the ball
tighter to Cook this time and punched straight down the pitch to mid-off
juicy half volley from Mills, wide outside off stump and Cook bends the front knee into an elegant cover drive...places it past short extra-cover and it speeds away
touch wider outside off and Cook opts to let this one pass...handy start for England
round the wicket, cramps Mustard for room and he turns into the leg side gap between mid-on and square leg
good length outside off stump, left alone by Cook
good length from Martin, makes Cook uncertain whether to play forward or back and he defends back towards the bowler
whipped from off stump straight to mid-on...strong wrists from Cook
tight call, seams away from round the wicket and Martin is surprised to see it signalled
probing line outside off stump, draws an edge from Cook which drops awkwardly in front of second slip and is palmed down to third man
shovelled towards square leg by Mustard but can't find the gap
punched firmly to mid-on...Cook looking much more comfortable with the extra pace in the pitch
full on off stump and Cook brings out a forceful drive, the bat turns in his hands and it goes too straight for mid-on
dropped into the off side, quick single to rotate the strike
now Mustard joins the party with a lofted drive over the covers, it nearly carries all the way but drops just inside the rope...positive start from England
drifts onto the pads and flicked with excellent timing into the leg side, goes one bounce to Peter Fulton at deep square-leg...Mustard almost hit that too well
flicked in the air wide of mid-on, not perfectly timed on this occasion
goes for a heave through the leg side, gets an inside edge into his pads which bobbles towards the slips
nudged firmly towards mid-on, and after a faultless game in Wellington a misfield allows Cook a single
dragged in short from Martin and Mustard is quickly onto the pull, dispatching it handsomely over deep square-leg and into the lap of a supporter on the grass bank

gone! There's the breakthrough for New Zealand as Mustard drives to drive but doesn't commit himself to going over the top. Daniel Vettori plucks out a neat, low catch at mid-off to end a rapid, but brief, opening stand.

well, well, it's all happened here! Two wickets in two balls as Brendon McCullum pulls off a blinding catch...Ian Bell shaped to leave his first ball, but as he withdrew his bat it caught the toe end and flew to the right of McCullum. The keeper flung himself to his right and brings off a blinder in front of first slip and sets off in celebration
full and driven into the covers, the shy hits the non-striker's stumps and they get an overthrow
full and straight, Pietersen loses control of the bat as he turns into the leg side
angling in towards the stumps, Pietersen gets into a bit of a tangle and there's half an appeal but it was going down leg
outside off stump, left alone and shapes away as it goes past Pietersen
advances down the pitch but is again taken on the pad as he tries to work into the leg side
full on the stumps, defended firmly to mid-on
lovely on-drive from Pietersen as Mills overpitches on the stumps and it is effortlessly placed past the stumps
tucked into the leg side
a sharp short ball nearly does the trick for Martin as Pietersen is surprised and is cramped on his pull. It evades short midwicket and square leg to bring Pietersen a streaky couple
outside off and left alone
punched firmly down the pitch, past the on side of the stumps to mid-on
keeping the ball pitched up, driven to mid-off
outside off stump, Pietersen steps across and defends
round the wicket, nudged wide of mid-on to bring up England's fifty...the rate is good but they have lost two important wickets
good length on off stump, defended back to Mason in his follow through
punchy drive from Pietersen, positive intent but picks out mid-off
slower ball outside off stump, Pietersen leaves it and McCullum takes on the second bounce
a drive skews of a thick inside edge through the leg side, deep square-leg comes round and keeps them to a single
defended back to Mason to end his first over
driven crisply back to Martin who gets a hand on it in his follow through but allows a single when he doesn't collect cleanly
opens the face and pushes square on the off side, finds the gap between backward point and cover
a top edge from Pietersen as another bouncer from Martin causes problems and it just evades fine leg to land in the grass bank...more luck than judgement there
class shot, half volley outside off stump which Pietersen places between cover and mid-off
and another...Pietersen rattling along here as he goes straight down the ground on this occasion and mid-off is too wide to do anything about it
outside off, seams back into Pietersen but it's a comfortable leave
driven firmly to mid-off and Mason slips in his follow through
turned from off stump just to the left of mid-on
perfect straight drive from Pietersen, too full and the shot gave mid-on no chance even though he got a finger on it
tightens up and Pietersen defends
short outside off stump, Pietersen goes for the pull but doesn't make contact...he is clearly trying to make the most of the fielding restrictions
slower ball on the stumps, waited for by Pietersen and turned past short fine-leg to keep the strike
Pietersen strides down and across the pitch, taken on the pad and the ball rolls into the leg side
round the wicket, full on off stump and driven up to mid-off
outside off and Cook watches this one go through...England have given themselves some breathing space with this flying start
turned off middle stump into the leg side and picks out midwicket
a crab-like punch down the ground from Cook, rather ugly but quite safe in the end
on off stump, Cook uses the angle and rolls his wrists to send the ball down to fine leg
half volley outside off but Cook picks out Ross Taylor at cover
turned down to mid-on, a moment of confusion as Cook wants a run but Pietersen doesn't and Cook scampers back
slower ball outside off, waited for by Cook and angled down to third man
another slow ball on off stump, Pietersen spots it and dabs into the covers
outside off and left alone, Mason has settled into a decent spell
turned through square leg for a comfortable single
appeal first up from Oram as Pietersen goes right across his stumps and is taken on the pads, but he is miles down the pitch and there was so much doubt
round the wicket, defended into the covers
outside off stump, seams away from Cook who has a prod and nearly gets the edge. Cook turns away in anger at the lose shot
forceful drive through the covers, Taylor gets a hand on it but dives over the ball and Vettori does the retrieving in the deep
flicked into the leg side
outside off stump, slightly slower ball, defended to mid-on by a walking Pietersen
driven to mid-off as Mason continues round the wicket
a touch short from Mason and Cook latches on with a screaming pull shot but is close to picking out Scott Styris at midwicket...was going like a tracer and would have taken some catching
slower ball pushed into the covers
another very slow ball, 64mph, and turned to midwicket
again whipped to midwicket
a forceful punch into midwicket but can't find the gap
full length, floated onto the spot outside off, met with a powerful straight drive, but well intercepted
clipped into the leg-side with a whip of the wrists but can'f find the gap
slower ball, slightly back of a length, defended
attempted yorker, comes out as a low full toss, but Pietersen plays all round it nonetheless and almost misses.
outside off, dies as it skids through to the keeper
squared up with a late-nipping legcutter, well fielded with a tumble at point. That's a good first over back
round the wicket, and edged fine, a genuine nick but no second slip to cut that off
big appeal, that was going down, and there was an inside-edge as well. Tight lines though

gone! Full and straight, and that's stone-dead as Pietersen shuffles across his crease in that now-habitual manner. Boos around the ground as England's finest falls without addition, and now his side are in some bother

oh dear, that's just village from England! Collingwood squirts an edgy single through backward point, but ridiculously, he decides to turn it into a tight two, even though he had to jink round the bowler in his followthrough. Oram's throw is fast and flat, and Asad Rauf doesn't even call for the replay!
banged in short, a bit of zip in the wicket after the rain. Shah swings into a pull, but doesn't come close to contact
onto the back foot, and drilled firmly into the covers
round the wicket, defended outside off
inside-edge, and that's given as byes, though there was a monstrous deflection that almost landed in McCullum's right mitt! So nearly a chance
nudged down to third man
good channel outside off stump, left alone
a big stride, into position for the drive, but instead just a measured push to cover
wider, and slashed firmly out to deep point
angled into the pads, clipped out to midwicket
slower ball, and finds a bit of inswing as well. A stifled appeal as a result, but that was going down
pushed into the covers, and fielded with a slide. New Zealand have been utterly alert

what a delivery! A fantastic offcutter, quicker pace and bit of nip off the seam, through a yawning gate and into the top of off stump. Three wickets in 14 balls, and England are collapsing in a hurry now
drawn forward into a smothering defence. Bat on ball first-up for Bopara
a wasted delivery, seaming away down leg
tapped into the leg-side, a hint of hesitation, but safely through to get off the mark
drawn forward and defended into the covers
massive appeal, Bopara was just walking across his stumps and that looked plumb to the naked eye. A grazed inside-edge saved him, maybe?
contact this time, as Bopara works to leg to bring up the 100.
outside off, sluggish carry, left alone
pushed down the track to mid-off, and Ross Taylor, with one stump to aim at, had Bopara at his mercy in the followthrough! He missed by a whisker, but Ravi is living dangerously
pushed out to point. Another tight over ticks by
short ball, tucked off the hips to a loud bellow of "no!" Just as well, as Shah was hurtling for a single
defended watchfully, on the move as the ball tails in late
driven airborne, but square - he was aiming straighter, but hit the gap in front of point. Not entirely convincing but England will take it
defended into the covers
tucked off the toes, picked up at square leg
width outside off, flailed into the covers, but cut off in the deep. Cook at least is looking composed. England need him to go big now, as the final 15 overs get underway
turned off the toes, down to fine leg
wicket-to-wicket delivery, an exaggerated defence in front of off stump
wider of the crease, looking to angle the ball in, but this one passes harmlessly past off stump
tighter line again, and defended again
a fraction back of a length, tucked into the off side and fielded at point
pushed forward, into the covers, and that's the end of another incredibly tight over
back of a length from around the wicket. Cook is looking to tuck that fine, but can't work the gap
picks the gap this time, off his toes out to deep midwicket, and that's his half-century - 65 balls and six fours. He's been the anchor, he might need to be the impetus too
bouncer, and an effective one too. Bopara swings airily, but no contact
full length, searching for the yorker, and driven up to mid-off
tip-and-run into the off side, a loud cry of  "no, no, no!" as Styris shies at the non-striker's end
just enough width to flick a single down to third man. Slim pickings for England at the mo
looped onto a wonderful line and length, hurried defensive prod
drifts onto leg stump, nurdled away
clipped hard to Jeetan Patel at midwicket, who fumbles momentarily, but still has time to wing in a shy at the non-striker's end. Had it hit, Bopara would have been out. Again.
cramped for room on the cut, backing away all the time, and so nearly inside-edges onto his stumps. Cunning bowling
more shovelling into the leg side
drilled down the ground, not timed, but that's as effective as it currently gets for England. They are in a bit of a pickle
slower ball, Bopara is early on the drive, and works it away through the gap at midwicket
outside off stump, extra kick off a good length, and played back down the track
outside off, clobbered hard off the back foot, but straight to short cover
a thick outside-edge, but a deliberate one. Third man fields on one knee
searching for the yorker, clipped into the deep
hustled for pace, a bit of a baseball slug into the off-side, and a quick single to complete the over
well bowled again, but just a smidgeon of width is enough for Bopara to get his late cut away. Good batting
turned into the leg-side, but no run
driven back to the bowler
pushed into the covers

abysmal running, and Cook is sold hopelessly down the river. A tame push into the covers, an instant and suicidal call, and McCullum doesn't even have to hustle up to the stumps to complete the run-out.
outside off stump, cut away
cut into the deep, a bit too much width first-up
steered firmly to gully
drawn forward in defence
busy footwork, cut straight to backward point
a firm "clop" echoes around the ground, that's nicely timed out to deep cover, but only a single
nurdled out to point, and that's another trouble-free over that slides by for New Zealand. When they aren't making breakthroughs, they aren't given runs away either
swatted down the ground, but doesn't quite carry to mid-off
attempted clip off the toes, but no contact
exaggerated, smothering, forward defence
massive appeal, but that sounded like bat and pad together. Fairly adjacent though
quicker, wider, and a slashing cut flies straight to McCullum! There goes another
forward and across to defend stoutly in front of off
defended stoutly in front of off stump
width, and swished into the deep with a conductor's flick of the wrists
angled across the left-hander, outside off, defended off the back foot, to short cover
stands tall and drives elegantly down the ground. It is pulled up just inside the rope, but that was a confident strike
worked back up the pitch to the bowler
tidy flick into the leg-side, picked up at midwicket
drilled down to mid-off, off the back foot. Another over goes by
driven into the gap in the covers, just beats the diving short cover
massive appeal for caught-behind from McCullum, but no-one else is interested. That was the arm ball, so maybe he was just pleased to have read it
defended outside off
down on one knee, and that's an exquisite sweep, timed to perfection, and straight into the gap at backward square
pushed into the covers, Bopara is itching for another suicidal run but this time he's sent back
clipped out to midwicket, and England have six overs left to set a target
short and misdirected, and Broad picks off another valuable boundary, just a steer down the leg-side
swished into the covers off the back foot, but well gathered at mid-off
fielded at mid-on this time
tip-and-run into the leg-side

full toss, and a sad end to a rather sad innings. It was waist-height and he could have put that anywhere, but instead he found Jesse Ryder lurking at deep midwicket. It's been another difficult day at the office for Bopara
short, and dispatched over square leg, cracking strike! That clears the rope by a distance, and taken comfortably by a man in the crowd with a ticket in his mouth ...
drawn forward, defended
punched into the on-side
pushed forward and picked up at short cover
no width to work with, Vettori fields in his followthrough
wider this time, but the perfect length. Steered to mid-on
big stride, but nothing doing there either
wide of off stump, but clubbed straight to mid-off
angled into the pads, tucked to square leg to bring up the 150
aiming for the yorker, ends up as a low full-toss, but it's a dot ball either way
Oram is as metronomic as he was in his first spell. Cover intercepts again
a smidgeon of width, and third man fields
tight to off stump, angled into the left-hander, defended
down the track with good intent, but Vettori drops short and Broad can only steer to short cover
beaten outside off stump, McCullum whips his bails off for good measure
nudged to cover

more comedy running, and there's the hat-trick of run-outs. It was almost a lobbed catch to Scott Styris at short third man, but instead it was a simple pot-shot, who hit the stumps from the edge of the ring. Woeful, I'm afraid
deflection off the gloves gives away a valuable single
another over ticks by, and England's abject innings is nearing completion
driven into the covers
inside-edge on the drive, and picked up at midwicket
banged in a fraction shorter, and How at backward point is briefly in business with a flying attempt that just eludes him
angled into the pads, the ball bobbles out to the off side, and for once, that qualifies as good running
aiming for the leg-stump yorker, well dug out and drilled to long-on
slower ball, defended back down the pitch. That's the end of a superb spell
a bit of width, a bigger hoon into the deep, and Mills at extra cover makes good ground to his left to cling onto a fine diving catch

inn2.comm: swings away outside off stump, Ryder not interested
slightly fuller and this one draws Ryder into a loose push at the ball without making contact
banged in on a good line, rises over off stump as Ryder sways out of the way
full on the stumps, pushed to mid-off
this one doesn't swing and it's defended back down the pitch, Sidebottom shows plenty of aggression in his follow through
a beauty to end the over, pitches and moves away from Ryder who is left pushing at thin air...super start from Sidebottom
drifts down the leg side first ball. Phil Mustard lets out a hopeful cry but can't fool anyone, especially the umpire
dropped a flashing drive from McCullum outside off stump and Mustard can only palm the chance wide of first slip...he went with one glove to his right and couldn't hang on. Could be costly
jags back into Ryder and takes the pad
poor ball, on the pads and picked up over square leg for an easy boundary...no messing from Ryder
short ball, Ryder goes for a fresh-air pull
turned to midwicket and hurled back at Mustard by Pietersen...England are pumped up but need to channel it
another failed attempt to pull as the ball slants across the left-hander making it hard to connect
on off stump and driven with real power in the air towards mid-off, it doesn't quite carry and becomes an awkward stop
slanting across McCullum and left alone
good line from Sidebottom, pushed into the covers
well bowled, probing area outside off stump and McCullum almost gets an edge as he pushed at the ball
top shot from McCullum as he takes a big stride towards the ball and picks up a hint of width, finds the gap between backward point and cover
takes the pad and drops into the leg side, Ryder responds for the quick single as Sidebottom tries a bit of football
that's huge from McCullum as he charges down the track then pulls a short ball well over the deep midwicket boundary for the first six of the innings
goes leg side again, advances towards Anderson then swings it hard and flat over square leg...this one bounces over the boundary
angled into the body, nudged through the leg side. They look for two but decide against it
hammered firmly into the covers and Ian Bell makes a fine diving save to prevent a boundary
defended into the off side and that moved man comes into action
pulled flat and hard over square leg and beats the man in the deep who only had to move a few meters to his left...that went like a tracer bullet. Great over for New Zealand
they are on the charge as McCullum comes down the track outside leg stump and smashes Sidebottom through the covers...one-way traffic and fielders and running everywhere
on the stumps and timed wide of mid-on. Again pushes for a couple but it's not available
punched into the covers
dropped another one goes down for England as Ryder gets an edge outside off stump which carries low to Owais Shah at first slip
turned through midwicket and Sidebottom uses some colourful language to show his frustration
worked through the huge gap on the leg side
starts on off stump, it's well timed into the covers but Bell is prowling again
drifts onto the pads, he has fine leg inside the circle and deep square can't get around in time
driven square to backward point
banged in short and Ryder helps himself to four more as he pulls down to long leg...he played that well as it was a decent bouncer above his head
and again, short and helped round the corner again with another pull...poor bowling from Broad who normally has such a smart head
at last he pitches up and Ryder tucks him into the leg side to keep the strike
picks the gap between backward point and cover, doesn't have enough force to reach the boundary but that was nice touch play from Ryder
good yorker, targeting the stumps and well dug out
hint of width outside off stump allowing Ryder to free his arms and drive the ball imperiously through the covers despite a fielder getting a hand on it
and again, this is carnage from New Zealand as Ryder drives off the front foot this time through the covers...England are clueless, and New Zealand all over them
banged in short and Ryder is going all guns blazing. Latches onto another pull and no one has a hope of catching it
something of a victory for Sidebottom, he keeps Ryder to a single as he pushes towards mid-on but New Zealand are racing away with this game
driven down to long-off
worked off the stumps through the leg side, easy pickings with the field spread
outside off stump, McCullum comes across the crease and works to the leg side
whipped from outside off stump through midwicket, sweeper keeps them to twi
just a fraction short, but McCullum has come down the track again and swings it dismissively over deep square-leg
more positive footwork and a firm drive straight at mid-off
round the wicket, tries to pull through midwicket but doesn't connect cleanly
swing and a miss at another attempted pull...he can't stop himself
wide outside off stump, slashed away one bounce to third man
long hop outside off stump, flat-batted through the covers and Cook pulls off a good save on the deep cover fence
low full toss driven to mid-off
driven back down the pitch, on the bounce to Anderson
pushed into midwicket, can't beat the field
on off stump, pushed into the covers
a step down the pitch and whipped effortlessly over deep square leg, goes many miles back and that was an awesome shot
short and wide outside off stump, flashing cut and edges high out of the reach of Mustard...this match is racing to a finish
banged in and rises through to Mustard
angled out to backward point
width, and glided through the gap at backward point. Threading the needle
that has travelled absolutely miles! Reminiscent of Yuvraj Singh's fifth six against Broad at Durban, underneath the ball with a brutal slog, and that sails over the stand at midwicket
width, and flogged past point. This is entertainment!
a rare dot ball ... a swish and a miss outside off
right up into the blockhole, chiselled out to point
low full toss, and this smeared pull isn't even middled, but it still flies for four. New Zealand's 100 comes up in just 11 overs!
sharp tweak into the pads
floated onto a good length, shovelled to deep midwicket
good delivery in the circumstances. Defended in front of off stump
too wide, and that's bludgeoned up and over extra cover, one bounce and over the rope
reverse sweep, and Anderson at short fine leg dives straight over the ball!
short, and pulled through square leg. England have utterly surrendered and it is pitiful to behold. Unless, of course, you are one of the raucous home fans at Hamilton
full length, on leg stump, turned casually into the deep and good running makes two
that's the length. Pushing Ryder back into the crease, on off stump
slower ball, comes out as a bit of a long hop, but enough deception nonetheless
width, and walloped up and over. Plugs in no-man's land in the covers
carved down to third man. Wonderful free swinging through the line
keeps the strike with a nudge into the gap. How soon will this be over?
cramped for room, can't connect
no problems connecting this time. A juicy half-volley, and flannelled over cow corner with utter disdain!
a rare dot ball
wide outside off stump, drilled down to long-on
slog-swept from outside off stump, cut off in the deep by the leg-side sweeper
smashed! Utterly smashed! A free swing of the blade, a full pivot on bended knee, and the sixth six of the innings sails into the stands
dispatched with murderous disdain! A flat swing over midwicket, a short-arm jab off an attempted slower ball.
full toss, on the legs. An optimistic appeal, and another run
outside off, pushed square, picked up at point
slower ball, pushed out to cover. Another big hit was being lined up there ...
steered round the corner to keep the strike
on the pads, wafted away
dropped! Oh good grief. A slower ball, came out as a long-hop, spooned straight back to the bowler, who shells a sitter in his followthrough. Sums it up really
in the air again, but chipped safely over the leg-side infield
a better pull, along the ground out to square leg
flogged on one knee, out to deep cover, Cook running in can't get his hands to the opportunity. Not a chance.
a swing and a miss. Ryder's in a hurry now
slower ball, yorker length, dug out
cut, in the air, out to deep cover
outside off stump, a swish and a miss, Mustard takes
bouncer, and a good take standing up to the stumps
slower ball again, patted into space on the off side
tight to off stump, but cut firmly - so firmly in fact that point can't gather cleanly. The ball ricochets away for two
square-driven to point
slashed down to third man, with an open face. Fielded on the first bounce
good line and length, but calmly deflected down to third man. Single figures now needed
short, wide and ugly. Down the leg side
nudged to gully, an instant call and Ryder was a sitting duck had the shy come in. But Collingwood missed by a mile, appropriately enough
long-hop, pulled firmly and just short of midwicket. New Zealand living dangerously now. As well they might. It would be a shame if these two didn't see them home though
clipped down to third man, and now one boundary would do the trick
outside off, a step back and across, and a cool slap through the covers wraps up one of England's most humiliating defeats of all time
